title: Labour rifts deepen as Jeremy Corbyn sidelines chief of staff Karie Murphy 'he had no confidence in'
text:
Jeremy Corbyn has lost one of his closest allies as splits in the Labour leader’s top team deepen.

Karie Murphy, once considered to be one of the influential figures in Mr Corbyn’s inner circle, has been moved out of the Labour leader’s office and will work from the party’s headquarters on election campaign preparations.

The departure of the Labour leader’s chief of staff comes just three weeks after Andrew Fisher, his policy guru, resigned, citing a “lack of professionalism, competence and human decency” from some at the top of the party.

It is understood Mr Fisher’s departure, along with a botched attempt to remove Tom Watson as deputy leader last month, lead some at the top to demand Ms Murphy...
description: Jeremy Corbyn has lost one of his closest allies as splits in the Labour leader’s top team deepen.
